message.content:
cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.DB

The paper discusses the challenges and experiences in building and researching recommender systems for digital libraries and reference managers. This involves dealing with noisy data, identifying promising recommendation approaches, creating a randomization engine for A/B tests, and calculating bibliometrics. These topics are relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC), Deep Learning (cs.DL), Machine Learning (cs.LG), and Databases (cs.DB). However, since the focus is on recommender systems, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.HC and cs.DL.
